title: System can be shut down without save file warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file. The text file is marked as a dirty file. Left clicking on the Windows Start menu and selecting the "Shut Down" command to shut down or reboot the computer does not display a warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty file(s). The computer is shut down or rebooted immediately without any prompt.
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project.
3. Add a line of text to the file.
4. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
5. Left click on the Windows Start menu.
6. Select the "Shut Down" command to shut down or reboot the computer.
7. Observe that there is no warning or question message box displayed.
8. Observe that the computer is shut down or rebooted immediately without any prompt.
